meanings.definition: A person who is superior to or has authority over other ministers.
meanings.sent1: The superministers in the government make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The Prime Minister appointed several superministers to oversee different departments.
meanings.sent3: The superministers held a meeting to discuss the new policies, but ended up arguing about who gets the biggest office.
meanings.sent4: She was like a superminister in the classroom, guiding her classmates with wisdom and authority.
meanings.sent5: The image of the superministers sitting at the round table, discussing the fate of the nation, was etched in his mind.

meanings.sent1: He superministers the team with efficiency and fairness.
meanings.sent2: She superministers the project, ensuring all tasks are completed on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to superminister the other pets in the house, making sure they followed the rules.
meanings.sent4: The sun superministers the sky, shining brightly and providing light to the world.
meanings.sent5: As the captain of the ship, he superministers the crew, leading them through stormy seas with courage.
